title: Banned for... what? Come on Riot.
body:
So I have just been permanently banned after one bad game where we had an inting/trolling midlaner and a griefing top who flamed our whole team after performing poorly. I bit back at his remarks and ended up with a permanent ban on my account. I was "toxic" in the sense that I actually argued with the player and swore a few times and called one player an idiot (the dude who was clearly trolling, doing emotes and following me around my jungle camps trying to last-hit everything I was attacking for a solid 2 minutes).

I started playing a few games last week after a 2 month break, so keep in mind this is the only game I got reported against in the past two months minimum.

Does the chat log REALLY display behavior that is so toxic it deserves a permanent ban? I feel like this kinda trash talk/banter/toxicity is pretty damn omnipresent throughout the entire league community. Just look at any streamer and he'll sound almost exactly like this on a bad game. 

To conclude, I've never intentionally fed/trolled/griefed players, especially in ranked. I like the game and the community is alright, but we all have had bad games and not everybody handles it in the most effective manner. It really amazes me that Riot will permanently ban the ACCOUNT for a CHAT-related offense when they can easily permanently MUTE the account instead. If a certain player tilts towards toxicity once in a while but otherwise respects the rules of the game, just take away their ability to use the public chat system? This solution has been so damn obvious for years, but that's just my two cents.

replies.body: What is also obvious is that people who cannot control themselves in chat want to lash out at teammates when they're mad. If you take away their chat, they'll lash out in other ways - griefing, trolling, playing differently, or even just not playing their best. All of those behaviors are much harder to detect, confirm, and punish than chat toxicity.
I hope you realize how much of an exaggerated and completely false assumption that second statement is. You're quite ignorant.
His statement is backed up by real data when Rito did a "perma chat ban" experiment.  What's your statement based off of?

My statement is based off that fact that I removed the chat box from the game display for a year and wasn't reported once that entire time, nor did I troll, grief or "play differently", whatever the fuck that's supposed to mean. I didn't need the chat system whatsoever, in fact I played much better without the constant distraction of other players instigating arguments. 

Also, I call bullshit on pretty much anything Riot says, as they're not legally obliged to tell the truth on a lot of what they post. So for that experiment they conducted, they can legitimately just throw any pile of garbage together and call it "proof" that chat mutes would lead to worse behavior/alternative means of expressing discontent. The same applies to "You are among the 0.006% of players that are toxic enough to be permanently banned", which is such an obviously biased manipulation of statistics. The link I put below eloquently explains just how dumb Riot is for putting a message like that whenever someone gets permabanned.

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/6rNe6xZ3-riot-the-numbers-you-give-for-banned-players-just-dont-add-up-math-inside
So circumstantial evidence which is worth VERY little.

so....you have your 1 data point vs. RIto's experiment on the entire playerbase of millions.

You cannot know if you wasn't reported unless you did request your data from Rito support.  People do quietly report other people for whatever makes them unhappy/uncomfortable.  Whether those were valid reports or not are a different story.
I encourage you to read the comments on that thread which explain just how that number is very possibly accurate.
Your chat logs literally show you being a complete jerk, I see nothing false about this. The truth hurts man and you gotta learn to accept it. The punishment should fit the crime.
Is not an assumption. It is an experimentally backed fact from when Riot did this before.

From [Riot Tantram:](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/wsObUaFj-if-tyler1?comment=00010001000000000000) 

> It really breaks down into two categories.
> 
> 1.) Helping players reform
> 2.) Shielding others from the behavior, at a cost.
> 
> We used to issue chat restrictions that essentially scaled indefinitely. 
> 
> We were able to determine that after a certain point the penalty no longer helped with reform. The 10-game and 25-game counts for chat restrictions are based on data that they were both light enough, and felt strict enough to encourage people to understand their behavior is unacceptable in game and change it.
> 
> We also saw that the players in this 'large restriction' category defaulted to gameplay altering means of harassing their team. It caused an increase in feeding and trolling.
> 
> The sample size of this population and time frame is huge. Essentially the time spanning from the introduction of chat restrictions to the introduction of IFS.
> 
> So my question for you is, would you rather have more feeders and less negative chat?

> dude stfu you let fiora roam like mad

like how could they control whether the enemy Fiora will TP around the map aside from clearing all wards, minions, turrets so that Fiora has nothing to TP to, or simply keeping Fiora dead the whole time which is impossible lol

Also, don't worry your account is only level 64, I have seen people come to the boards with level 200 accounts with years of grinding and hundreds of dollars spents on skins lost simply due to some buttery fingers, lets just admit it, it is time to move on...

I 100% agree a chat restriction should be applied for negative attitude/mild toxicity, but a permaban is just plain stupid. I wrote that message because he wrote that we were all bad for being behind on cs/losing lanes, while his top laner teleported bot twice and came mid once all before the 12-minute marker. When someone roams that much, you either punish them by pushing turrets, counter their teleport with a teleport of your own, get ahead on cs, etc. This guy was 0-4-0, ironically also behind on cs, never helped the team with any of his own teleports and flamed the entire team non-stop. Of course I'm gonna tell him to stfu lmao
Just make an appeal. I got a perm but got it removed. I guarantee you if you get your account back from a perm you'll never flame again
